title: Print, "The temples of Apollo and Diana built for the first day of the fireworks at SS. Peter and Paul by Paolo Posi", 1763
medium:
Etching
Paper; watemark: lily in double ovoid topped by V
description: Horizontal rectangle.  The two circular, domed temples, to which steps lead, are at left (Apollo) and right (Diana) and are connected by a bridge structure.  In the background is the Palazzo Franese, decorated for the celebration.  In the foreground, workers cut wood while other participants form a procession with smoking vessels.  Framing lines.  Bottom:  "Disegno della Prima Machina rappresentante i Temii...Incendiata per commando di Sua Eccelenza il Sigr DON LORENZO COLONNA Gran Contestabile de / Regno di Napoli S S come Amdella presentazione della Chinea alla Santita di Nostro Signore PAPA / CLEMENTE XIII, nella Vigilia de Gloriosi S. S. Apostoli PIETRO E PAOLO l'anno 1763" / "Paolo Posi Architetto"  "Giuseppe Palazzi dis."  "Giuseppe Vasi incise."

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "The temples of Apollo and Diana built for the first day of the fireworks at SS. Peter and Paul by Paolo Posi", 1763.Etching
Paper; watemark: lily in double ovoid topped by V. 1924-15-141.
